channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - HP Hero
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2019 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: The ultimate target of all this week's scrutiny will be in Vietnam, preparing for his summit with Kim Jong Un
item.description: The reckoning that has been due for the Trump administration ever since Democrats won the midterm elections is about to hit with full force, with a multi-front oversight offensive targeting the President and his senior officials.

item.title: Don Lemon: The stakes could not be higher
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon details a timeline of President Trump's big week ahead, emphasizing Trump's visit with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un as his former personal attorney Michael Cohen testifies before Congress.

item.title: Rosenstein on Bill Barr: 'We can count on him to do the right thing'
item.description: Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein expressed confidence Monday in Attorney General Bill Barr's judgment in overseeing the special counsel's Russia investigation, as Democratic lawmakers gear up to pressure the Justice Department to turn over Robert Mueller's findings.

item.title: Jake Tapper debunks Trump Jr.'s 'bold' Mueller assertion
item.description: CNN's Jake Tapper reacts to Donald Trump Jr. downplaying connections to people already implicated in special counsel Robert Mueller's Russia investigation.

item.title: Michael Cohen needs to answer these five questions
item.description: Michael Cohen's public testimony before the House Oversight Committee on Wednesday will crackle with the human drama, high stakes and political intrigue of a John Grisham novel. President Donald Trump's longtime attorney -- now a convicted felon soon to report to federal prison -- will respond to grilling by a sharply-divided panel of politicians about the corrupt inner workings of the Trump campaign and the man he once served but has now turned on.

item.title: Andrew McCabe makes his case on why he's credible
item.description: Former FBI deputy director Andrew McCabe says he believes President Trump influenced an inspector general's finding that McCabe made false statements about the disclosure of information to a media outlet.

item.title: Manafort's lawyers taunt Mueller for not tying him to Russian interference in 2016 election
item.description: Paul Manafort's legal defense team, in one of its last opportunities to hit back at prosecutors, taunted special counsel Robert Mueller for not bringing a case that tied the former Trump campaign chairman to Russian government interference in the 2016 election.

item.title: Republican senator says he'll vote against Trump's national emergency
item.description: Republican Sen. Thom Tillis will vote in favor of a resolution against President Donald Trump's declaration of a national emergency at the border, the North Carolinian wrote Monday in a Washington Post op-ed

item.title: Wisconsin governor pulls National Guard from southern border
item.description: Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers ordered the state's 112 troops to leave their posts along the US' southern border Monday evening.

item.title: Trump-Kim summit: What does a win for North Korea look like in Hanoi?
item.description: The stakes are high for Trump-Kim round two.

item.title: Bernie Sanders praises Trump's meetings with Kim Jong Un
item.description: After criticizing President Trump on several occasions, presidential candidate Bernie Sanders praised Trump's summits with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.

item.title: Opinion: Bernie Sanders' platform sounds strangely familiar
item.description: The CNN town hall with Bernie Sanders on Monday night showed the Vermont senator picking up where he left off in 2016: Calling for higher taxes on the wealthy, single-payer health care and a dramatic expansion of government support for programs including pre-kindergarten and university education.

item.title: Jon Stewart calls out Congress: This is beyond comprehension
item.description: Comedian and 9/11 first responders advocate Jon Stewart visited Capitol Hill to fight for a permanent bill that would provide 9/11 first responders and their families with financial assistance.

item.title: Former campaign staffer sues Trump, alleging that he kissed her without consent
item.description: A former Trump campaign staffer is suing President Donald Trump and his campaign, alleging that race the then-Republican presidential candidate kissed her without her consent during the 2016 race. She's also suing over equal pay -- claiming that she was paid less for her work based on race and gender.

item.title: Analysis: Trump's absurd July 4th bash
item.description: Donald Trump likes big productions. Big bashes. Ideally to honor him.

item.title: Sex trafficking probe began with a routine health inspection at spa
item.description: It's now a sprawling sex trafficking investigation involving many jurisdictions and ensnaring wealthy, powerful suspects, but it began with a health inspector observing curious details suggesting women might be living at a Jupiter, Florida, day spa.

item.title: What we know about the Robert Kraft probe
item.description: Robert Kraft, the owner of the New England Patriots, has been arrested as part of a monthslong investigation into sex trafficking that focused on several central Florida day spas and massage parlors suspected of being used for prostitution.

item.title: 183 still stuck on Amtrak train in snowy Oregon after more than 24 hours
item.description: An Amtrak train headed for Los Angeles with nearly 200 people on board came to a standstill Sunday evening after hitting a tree that had fallen onto the tracks.

item.title: Brooke Baldwin: Enough is enough
item.description: CNN's Brooke Baldwin details allegations of sex abuse of vulnerable women by powerful men.

item.title: Pennsylvania mother and daughter accused of killing five relatives
item.description: A Pennsylvania mother and her daughter are in police custody, accused of killing five of their relatives, according to the Bucks County District Attorney's Office.

item.title: UN court ruling puts future of strategic US military base Diego Garcia into question
item.description: The UK must return the Chagos Islands to Mauritius "as rapidly as possible," the United Nations' highest court ruled Monday, branding its occupation of the Indian Ocean archipelago illegal.

item.title: Money motivated NJ man to kill his brother and family at mansion, indictment says
item.description: The man accused of killing of his younger brother, sister-in-law and the couple's children at their New Jersey mansion just days before Thanksgiving was indicted Monday.

item.title: Falling rock and ice kill woman at Yosemite
item.description: A woman died at Yosemite National Park in California on Sunday, after park officials say she was hit by falling rock and ice.

item.title: News crew robbed at gunpoint
item.description: A television news crew reporting on the Oakland teacher's strike were involved in a shooting when armed gunmen robbed them of their camera equipment.

item.title: Kraft Heinz is sitting on debt worth almost $31 billion
item.description: The Kraft Heinz food empire has a debt problem.

item.title: SEC asks judge whether Elon Musk should be held in contempt
item.description: The Securities and Exchange Commission has asked a federal judge to decide if Tesla CEO Elon Musk should be held in contempt of a settlement deal reached last year.

item.title: WWE star announces his cancer is in remission
Rami Malek falls off stage at Oscars
item.description: Rami Malek, who won the best actor award for "Bohemian Rhapsody," was treated by paramedics after he fell off the Oscars stage after the ceremony concluded.

item.title: NBA star 'lucky to be alive' after car accident
Winds push ice over Niagara River wall
item.description: Video shared by the Niagara Parks Police in Canada shows heavy winds blowing ice over the retaining wall along the Niagara River near Lake Erie.

item.title: Bizarre standoff as goalie refuses to be subbed
NFL owner reportedly buys $180 million yacht
Prince Harry feigns surprise at pregnancy
item.description: Britain's Prince Harry jokingly pretended to be shocked at his wife Meghan's pregnancy, while visiting a girl's school in Morocco.

item.title: Plane attempts scary landing in strong winds
item.description: A British Airways flight was forced to divert from its planned course after being dramatically buffeted by strong winds off the coast of Spain on Monday.

item.title: A close adviser to the Pope is guilty of child sex abuse
item.description: One of the most powerful men in the Roman Catholic Church was found guilty of multiple historical child sex offenses at a secret trial in Melbourne in December, the existence of which can only now be revealed.

item.title: How a choir boy brought down a powerful cardinal
item.description: One of the most powerful men in the Roman Catholic Church was brought down the lone voice of a former choirboy.

item.title: Why conviction is being reported now, two months later
item.description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

item.title: CNN reporter: Conviction is absolutely explosive
item.description: CNN's Anna Coren explains the significance of the conviction of Cardinal George Pell, the third-highest ranking member of the Catholic Church, who could face prison time for sexually abusing children.

item.title: Nun reads the riot act to Catholic bishops over clergy sex abuse
item.description: Sister Veronica Openibo, a Nigerian-born nun, is one of only three women to address an unprecedented Vatican summit on clergy sexual abuse.

item.title: A rare glimpse into Afghanistan's 'shadow government'
How two CNN reporters gained access to Taliban
item.description: CNN's Chief International Correspondent Clarissa Ward, and Field Producer Salma Abdelaziz describe how being female journalists helped them obtain access to the Taliban.

item.title: US officials warn about ISIS' Afghanistan branch
item.description: ISIS' Afghanistan-based affiliate has emerged as a major threat capable of carrying out direct attacks on the US and is actively using its members' social media to acquire contacts in the United States, a US intelligence official in Afghanistan tells CNN.

item.title: Opinion: Afghans fear Trump team is about to sell them out
item.description: Kabul is a city on edge. Twenty-foot-high concrete blast walls surround the "Green Zone," sheltering the US embassy and key Afghan government buildings.

item.title: Watch Spike Lee react to 'Green Book' Oscar win
item.description: Backstage at the Oscars, Spike Lee explained his reaction to "Green Book' winning Best Picture.

item.title: Serena's Nike ad exposes double standards women face at work
item.description: Dramatic, nuts, delusional, unhinged, hysterical, irrational, and, of course crazy.

item.title: The Academy Awards, in pictures
item.description: Hollywood's best are being honored Sunday night at the 91st Academy Awards.

item.title: A mom found videos on YouTube Kids that gave children instructions for suicide
item.description: Most parents feel pretty safe letting their children watch YouTube Kids, the child-friendly version of the video platform.

item.title: 5G networks are here: Here's everything you need to know
item.description: 5G wireless networks promise super-fast speeds, and they will usher in the next wave of technology.

item.title: How to best diversify your investment portfolio
item.description: What are the criteria you look out for when buying stocks, especially when you want to diversify your portfolio?

item.title: Cleaning New York's filthy harbor with one billion oysters
item.description: The New York Harbor for years has been polluted and depleted of marine life. But one nonprofit is working to clean the murky water and revive its long-lost ecosystem one oyster at a time.

item.title: UK Labour backs a second referendum
item.description: The main opposition party in the UK is throwing its weight behind another referendum on Brexit.

item.title: US says airstrike kills 35
item.description: The US military announced Monday that an airstrike in Somalia killed 35 Al Shabaab fighters on Sunday.

item.title: Iran Foreign Minister Javad Zarif resigns
item.description: Iran's foreign minister, Mohammad Javad Zarif, who played a key role in the 2015 nuclear deal, announced his resignation Monday.

item.title: 15yr fixed rates just declined. See if you qualify
Fastest way to pay off $10,000 in credit card debt
Motley Fool issues rare "Ultimate Buy" alert
The reason your job can't buy your happiness
item.description: Fifteen years ago, when journalist and author Charles Duhigg received his degree from Harvard Business School, he remembers he and his classmates being excited by their "good luck," as he writes in the New York Times Magazine. "A Harvard M.B.A. seemed like a winning lottery ticket, a gilded highway to world-changing influence, fantastic wealth and ... a lifetime of deeply meaningful work."

item.title: What 2020 Dems can't afford to ignore about Bernie
item.description: Sen. Bernie Sanders launched his second presidential bid on Tuesday and turned heads by raising $5.9 million right out of the gate. Within 24 hours of his announcement, more than 223,000 people had donated to the campaign. The numbers easily outpaced his rivals. Sen. Kamala Harris, for instance, raised $1.5 million in 24 hours, while Sen. Amy Klobuchar received $1 million in donations in the first 48 hours of her campaign launch.

item.title: False Trump-Kim fairy tale is nothing to celebrate
item.description: When Donald Trump and Kim Jong Un convene at their upcoming summit in Hanoi, Vietnam, many Vietnamese people around the globe will be glowing with pride.

item.title: Trump's 'domestic gag rule' is un-American
item.description: In an attempt to keep one of his many outlandish campaign promises, the so-called most "pro-life" president has cemented his willingness to attack the millions of people who obtain confidential and affordable health care via Title X, the federal program that provides millions of low-income Americans with birth control and other reproductive health services.

item.title: Trump's July 4th sounds like a salute to Trump
item.description: I think it's safe to say that President Donald Trump wants this July 4th to be all about him. At least that's the impression I got reading his Sunday morning tweet about the summer holiday celebration he is planning: "HOLD THE DATE! We will be having one of the biggest gatherings in the history of Washington, D.C., on July 4th. It will be called "A Salute To America" and will be held at the Lincoln Memorial. Major fireworks display, entertainment and an address by your favorite President, me!"

item.title: Regina King's win puts her in very cool company
item.description: Regina King is now an Oscar winner.

item.title: 'Shallow' had us swooning
item.description: Bradley Cooper and Lady Gaga: Is it hard keeping it so hardcore?

item.title: See who took home an Oscar
item.description: The 91st Academy Awards are Sunday.

item.title: Michael B. Jordan makes us all look lazy
item.description: It's late November and Michael B. Jordan is preparing to head overseas. He leaves on Thanksgiving for an international leg of press for his film "Creed II." His travels were going to take him to places like London and Africa. Then his schedule had him diving into award season here in the states. March, he said, would bring a breather.

item.title: Microsoft CEO defends US military contract that some employees say crosses a line
item.description: Satya Nadella has defended Microsoft's $479 million contract to supply augmented reality systems to the US military that has been criticized by some of his colleagues.

item.title: This startup makes your parties Insta-worthy
item.description: Coterie, a new ecommerce startup, sells party kits and items that turn any event into an ultimate Instagram-worthy spectacle.

item.title: New $3,500 AR headset means business
item.description: The newest version of Microsoft's augmented reality headset is designed to help workers of all types better do their jobs.

item.title: What is 5G?
item.description: 5G will be the lifeblood of the new economy.
